criteria: Development of Ideas Over the Course of the Text
descriptions: The student fails to identify any central ideas or information from the source.
The student identifies a central idea/information, but it is vague, inaccurate, or incomplete.
The student identifies a central idea/information with some accuracy, but misses key components or details.
The student identifies a central idea/information accurately and provides sufficient details.
The student identifies multiple central ideas/information accurately, demonstrating a strong understanding of the source.
The student identifies multiple central ideas/information comprehensively and insightfully, demonstrating a deep understanding of the source.
The student provides no summary or a completely inaccurate summary of the text.
The student provides a summary with significant inaccuracies or omissions.
The student provides a somewhat accurate summary, but it is missing key events or ideas.
The student provides a generally accurate summary of the text, including most key events or ideas.
The student provides an accurate and detailed summary, capturing the essence of the text and its key components.
The student provides a highly accurate, comprehensive, and nuanced summary, demonstrating a thorough understanding of the text's content and structure.
The student does not address how key events or ideas develop over the course of the text.
The student attempts to describe the development of ideas, but the explanation is unclear or inaccurate.
The student describes the development of some ideas, but misses key connections or transitions.
The student describes how key events or ideas develop over the course of the text with reasonable clarity and accuracy.
The student clearly and accurately traces the development of key events or ideas, demonstrating an understanding of their progression.
The student insightfully analyzes the development of key events or ideas, revealing nuanced connections and implications within the text.
